item.title: Ticket #2742 (Trackback spam causes CPU usage too high) created
item.dc:creator: brianbonner
item.description:
I have been battling this problem for a while now. A Blue host engineer states it is the way WP-trackback is accessed not ending the transmission quick enough and recommended a mod_rewrite plugin to block TB spam: ​http://blog.mytechaid.com/archives/2005/03/09/wordpress-trackback-spam-solution/

He said he has seen it before and has seen good results, I have just installed it. This is something that must be addressed because TB spam is regularly making my blog go over a 20% CPU usage. I have seen other problems with cpu usage mentioned in the support areas with no solutions.

I have both badbehavior and spam karma installed, it doesn't matter. bad behavior still lets quite a bit through.

I am running 2.0.2.

Thank you.

item.title: Ticket #2707 (smiley converter creates URLs with the wrong base - patch included) updated
item.dc:creator: westi
item.description:
Keywords, Priority, Milestone changed

I think we can say that this patch is invalid for the reason MattRead states above.

If you want a secure admin can you not use the ​SecureAdmin plugin?

item.title: Ticket #2707 (smiley converter creates URLs with the wrong base - patch included) updated
item.dc:creator: MattRead
item.description: I think the "wordpress address" has to be used, cause it's the full path the the wp-* dirs, whereas "blog address" is the path to the permalinks base. so if you install in /wordpress/ and serve from /, the paths to the smilies will be off.... interesting dilemma.

item.title: Ticket #2741 (categories and subcategories) created
item.dc:creator: Denis-de-Bernardy
item.description:
Given the following tree with the number of posts in parenthesis: 

- root (1)
  - cat1 (0)
    - cat11 (1)
  - cat2 (1)

One would expect WordPress to understand: 

- root (3)
  - cat1 (1)
    - cat11 (1)
  - cat2 (1)

WordPress seems to understand: 

- root (1)
  - cat1 (0)
  - cat2 (1)
